Core Application & Web Stacks -> Web Dev.rationale: This option is chosen because it allows us to build a web application for an online bakery shop, where users can browse and purchase cakes.
Core Application & Web Stacks -> Web Dev.purpose: Enables creation of the frontend interface for the online bakery shop

Web Development -> Backend.rationale: As the user requirement is to build a backend for an online bakery shop that sells cakes, it is necessary to focus on the backend development.
Web Development -> Backend.purpose: This option enables the creation of database models, APIs, and server-side logic essential for managing inventory, processing orders, and facilitating interactions between the frontend application and the database.

Backend -> REST.rationale: REST is widely adopted and supported by most programming languages, making it easier to find resources for development.
Backend -> REST.purpose: Allows creation of stateless services that can be easily scaled horizontally.

REST -> Java.rationale: Java is widely used for large-scale, enterprise applications and has robust libraries for building backends.
REST -> Java.purpose: Allows for efficient development of a secure and scalable backend solution.

Java -> Spring Boot.rationale: Popularity, large community support, and extensive documentation make Spring Boot an ideal choice for a backend application.
Java -> Spring Boot.purpose: Enables rapid development of a robust Java-based RESTful API.

Spring Boot -> Tomcat.rationale: Tomcat is a popular and well-documented servlet container for Spring Boot applications.
Spring Boot -> Tomcat.purpose: It enables easy deployment and running of the online bakery shop backend
